basic_information.scholarship_name: Jan Pokorny Steele Endowed Piano Scholarship-NOMINATION

description: This scholarship was established in 2005 to honor the late Jan Pokorny Steele, who passed away that year after 29 years as a full-time faculty member in the School of Music. The scholarship may be awarded to a full-time piano major within the School of Music with a minimum 3.0 GPA. Eligibility Piano major Minimum cumulative GPA 3.0 Enrolling full time (12+ credit hours undergraduate, 9+ graduate) Responsibilities Recipient must be actively involved in the School of Music through events, programs and performances Recipient must demonstrate leadership in the School of Music and its programs Requirements AWARDED BY COMMITTEE NOMINATION. Nominated student(s) will be invited to apply by the college's scholarship coordinator

general_criteria.description: Soft requirements that provide additional points/consideration

hard_criteria.description: Hard requirements that must be met to qualify for the scholarship
